definition: to display one's slight skill before an expert (idiom)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with

sentences.english: He is always tell the director how to run the business; that's like teach his grandmother to suck egg.
sentences.chinese: 他老是对总裁说该如何管理业务，就跟班门弄斧似的。

sentences.english: In terms of writing, I dare not show off in the presence of an expert like you.
sentences.chinese: 说到写文章，我实在不敢在你面前班门弄斧。

sentences.english: This idiom excoriates those who show accomplishments in front experts.
sentences.chinese: “班门弄斧”这个成语，用来在行家面前显示本领。

sentences.english: Your cooking is better than mine, and I certainly prefer not having to bother to cook at all.
sentences.chinese: 你的菜煮得比我好，我当然就不想班门弄斧了。

sentences.english: Facing the teacher. I can't teach fish to swim.
sentences.chinese: 在老师面前，我不能班门弄斧。

sentences.english: He is always telling the director how to run the business; that's like teaching his grandmother to suck eggs.
sentences.chinese: 他老是对总裁说该如何管理业务，就跟班门弄斧似的。

sentences.english: Speaking of writing article, I dare not show off in front of you.
sentences.chinese: 说到写文章，我实在不敢在你面前班门弄斧。

definition: lit. to wield the broadsword in the presence of Lord Guan (idiom)/fig. to make a fool of oneself by showing off in front of an expert
pinyin: Guan1 gong1 mian4 qian2 shua3 da4 dao1

definition: to show off/to make a display of
insignificant talent/skill of no high order/minor accomplishment
to make a fool of oneself/to make oneself a laughing stock
(humble expr.) of humble talent and shallow learning (idiom); Pray forgive my ignorance,...
avoiding doing something that one is clumsy at to save face
slight knowledge of sth/superficial acquaintance with a subject/a smattering
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
